intro: Laxmannia grandiflora subsp. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered laxmannia, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and attractive foliage.
